title: A Gift to the Shroud of Turin Blogosphere from Stephen Jones
post:
I am not sure if this was IW’s first public writing about the Shroud and I appreciated what he was writing because I myself was writing for a weekly once in a while, but on other topics such as theology, Church history and so forth.
His article caught the attention of Father Francis O’Leary because of the mattress imprint phenomenon, which was mentioned in at least one of his Shroud books. The good priest was giving it a spiritual connotation, making a connection with the TS, which was not convincing, however how could one bother someone who was involved in a much more important task, that is, trying to raise funds for his Hospice, where poor terminal patients could die with dignity?
IW and I agreed that the image-formation process in the Imprint and the TS was not the same:
 http://holyshroudguild.org/uploads/2/7/1/7/2717873/can_the_jospice_mattress_imprint.mht_2.pdf
Part II will be written and posted shortly.
Success in your research!
author: Louis
